topic: The EU should have a president elected directly by the people.
argument: People should be able to vote for their president. It's democracy. The president of the EU is a powerful position.

topic: Denial of the Holocaust should be illegal.
argument: Holocaus denial is akin to lying and should not be legal. It is an attempt to rewrite history. This is wrong.

topic: Prostitution should be legal.
argument: The sale of sex is a legitimate business. It should not be criminalized. Prohibition is not an effective way to deal with crime.

topic: Fat air passengers should be charged extra for their extra weight.
argument: It is unreasonable to charge people for being fat. It isn't their fault.

topic: The Commonwealth should be abolished.
argument: Many people enjoy the commonwealth. It should not be abandoned.

topic: The assassination of a dictator can be justified.
argument: An assassin is a murderer, and murder is wrong. If we want to get rid of someone, we should do it by the book.

topic: Mandating calorie counts on restaurant menus is good public policy.
argument: Some people have health issues and don't need to know how many calories are in their food.

topic: Schools have the right to search students' lockers.
argument: Students have a right against unreasonable searches. Lockers are a reasonable expectation of privacy. They are not shared spaces.

topic: High speed rail development is generally good policy.
argument: The high speed trains are costly.

topic: Marriage to more than one person should be legal.
argument: A marriage is a sacred bond. To have multiple spouses is not in keeping with the sanctity of marriage.

topic: Children should be allowed to work in the performing arts or professional sports.
argument: Child actors and athletes are at a disadvantage because they have not had a normal childhood. They are exploited.

topic: Assisted suicide should be legalized.
argument: People who are terminally ill have the right to choose assisted suicides. It's a personal decision.

topic: It is ethical for colleges, parents, or employers to get information about people from social networking websites.
argument: Social networking sites are not always accurate. It can be unreliable to base decisions off of information on them.

argument: Some people choose to be prostitutes. It is a legitimate job. If you are forced to do it, it is illegal.

topic: The assassination of a dictator can be justified.
argument: An assassinated dictators replacement is often just as bad. This is not an effective strategy. It is a crime against humanity.

topic: Iraq should be partitioned into three autonomous sectarian regions.
argument: The people of iraq are not happy with the government.

topic: Governments should completely ban laser pointers.
argument: Laser Pointers can be used for educational purposes. They should not be completely banned.

argument: Students need breaks. Year round schools eliminate that. It's not a great idea for students.

topic: A 700 mile fence on the US-Mexico border is justified.
argument: The 1099 mile US Canada border has a fencing system.

argument: Full-bodyscans are effective in preventing terrorism.

topic: The assassination of a dictator can be justified.
argument: Assassinations are never justifiable. It is never the answer to a problem. There are other solutions.

topic: The Three Gorges Dam is a good idea.
argument: It is necessary to provide power to the people. The three gorged dam will provide electricity to millions.

topic: Tibet should seek and gain independence.
argument: The Chinese have invested a lot in Tibets infrastructure. They should be allowed to keep it.

topic: Human reproductive cloning should be banned and punishments leveled against it.
argument: The cloned human is the creation of another and should not be allowed. It is like murder. No punishment is too severe.

topic: Governments should introduce identity cards and require each citizen to carry one.
argument: Identity cards are not necessary. It is possible to identify people without them. Identity theft is not an issue if people have nothing to steal.

argument: Public service is not the reason for pornography. It is for pleasure and nothing more.

argument: There are many people who don't have health insurance.

argument: It is not a wise idea to change the constitution of a country without a referendum. It should be done gradually.

topic: Physical force is a justifiable method of punishing criminals.

argument: Net neutralities will not be a boon for consumers.

Compulsory national service is a good idea.

argument: The world is a dangerous place and needs more protection. NATOs mission is to protect. Expanding is necessary.
